alert.note: Alert for Pickens (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 10:16AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Pickens. * WHEN...Until 215 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1016 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Aliceville, Carrollton, Pickensville, Ethelsville, Memphis, McMullen, Bevill Lock And Dam, Garden, Dillburg, McShan, Macedonia, George Downer Airport, Gainesville Lake Campground, Cochrane, Forest and Shaw.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
